msg.maintenance: Bungie API is brought down for maintenance
msg.later: The information will be updated later
msg.no_embed_links: No permission to 'Embed links', required for the posts.
msg.prefixes: Here are the available prefixes aside from `@{}`, i.e. you can send `{}prefix` to call this command.
msg.no_prefixes: The bot's commands can be invoked only with `@{}`
msg.no_notifiers: This channel is not set up for the posts. Please set it up with `/autopost` command.
msg.in_progress: Getting updates. If the types match with the registered channels, they will be posted. Keep in mind, that this command does not force me to get updates from Bungie.
msg.invalid_type: Invalid update type. Please see `help update` for the available update types.
msg.no_seasonal_reg: This channel is not registered as a seasonal notifier.
msg.no_regular_reg: This channel is not registered as a non-seasonal notifier.
msg.no_send_messages: {}, I'm not allowed to respond in that channel.
msg.clan_search_error: The requested clan was not found. You can try again with the clan's name being case-sensitive. If that doesn't help, try entering your clan's ID. The ID can be found on the clan's bungie.net page after the string `groupId=` (you want the numbers after that). If that doesn't work, you can always ask for help at my support server, the link to which can be found with the `support` command.
msg.deprecation_warning: This command is deprecated and will stop working <t:1650574800:D>. Please use it's slash version. If you don't see any slash commands, run `noslash` command to get instructions on how to fix this.
msg.no_dm: This command can't be used in DMs
msg.no_admin: You lack the administrator permissions to use this command
msg.noslash: Try adding the bot to this server again by clicking 'Add to Server' in the bot's profile. **DO NOT** kick the bot, this will delete all the settings for the server. If you need more help, feel free to ask at the support server. You can find the link to the support server by running the `support` command.

lfg.gotcha: Ok, please wait for the group's owner to add you to the participants
lfg.name: Provide the name of the activity
lfg.description: Describe, what are you going to do there
lfg.time:
When are you going to start? (format is `%d-%m-%Y %H:%M` for UTC+3 timezone and `%d-%m-%Y %H:%M%z`, for custom timezone)
Examples of the current time: `{}` for UTC+3, `{}` for custom timezone.
lfg.length: How long are you planning to do this? Example: 1h 30m for one and a half hour group.
lfg.type: What is the type of the activity?
lfg.mode: What is the mode for this group? ({} if you want to approve everyone, {} for automatic approvals)
lfg.again: Check your input and repeat the process.
lfg.too_long:
The answer is too long ({} symbols). Maximum length is {} symbols. You will need to answer again.
{}
lfg.dm_noedit: Send '--' if you don't want to change your previous answer.
lfg.lfg_choice: Send the number of the group from the list above.
lfg.lfg_choice_fail:
Unable to process the answer ('{}'). The answer should contain only numbers, i.e. '1' for the first LFG in the list and should be less, than {}.
{}
lfg.time_modal: When are you going to start?
lfg.length_modal: How long are you planning to do this?
lfg.length_placeholder: Example: 1h 30m for one and a half hour group.
lfg.role_manual: Name the roles to mention, separated by `;`. Send `-` for automatic role choice.
lfg.lfg_select: Select the group you want to edit.
lfg.will_not_delete: Only the group's owner can do this
lfg.not_a_post: This is not my LFG post!

r_desc: Venture into the mysterious Haul that the Drifter tows behind his ship to reckon with greater powers.
error: An unexpected error has occurred. The information was sent to the developer

help.list: __**Here's the list of all available commands**__
help.plan_maintenance: Prevent updates at given time frame
help.update: Get updates from Bungie for the selected types
help.setclan: Set Destiny 2 clan for the server.
help.top: Print top players for one of the available metrics.
help.additional_info: Type `{}help command` for more info on a `command`. Available languages are `{}` (Some lines might be untranslated).
help.aliases: Can be called with the following names:```{}```
help.no_command: Command `{}` was not found. Use `help` to get the list of available commands.

setclan.info: Set Destiny 2 clan for the server. You can use either clan's name or clan's ID. The clan's name and ID will be printed on success.

top.info: Print top players for one of the available metrics. Metric's description is available through the link. You can also pass the metric's hash to the command. Use `gtop` or `globaltop` to get lists across all the clans that are known to the bot.
top.cat_list: Available categories. To get the category's metric list send `{}help top category`. The categories are listed in the table below (left column), right column contains the descriptions of the aforementioned categories. The categories match in-game ones.

setlang.info: Available languages are {}. Available only to the server's admins.

update.info:
Get updates from Bungie for the given `args`. The types should be separated with spaces. Available args:
 - `daily` for strike modifiers and spider
 - `weekly` for available empire hunts and nightmares, current ordeal and crucible rotators
 - `spider` for material prices
 - `xur` for Xur's location and exotics
Updates are posted in the channel, the command was invoked, if the channel was registered with `regnotifier`. Everything, except `seasonal` is posted on the `notifier` channels. Available only to the server's admins.

rmnotifier.info: `upd_type` can be either 'notifier' for regular updates (daily, weekly, etc.) or 'updates' for the bot's updates. Defaults to 'notifier'. Available only to the servers admins.

regnotifier.info: `upd_type` can be either 'notifier' for regular updates (daily, weekly, etc.) or 'updates' for the bot's updates. Defaults to 'notifier'. Available only to the servers admins.

plan_maintenance.info: Available only to the bot's owners.

stop.info: Available only to the bot's owners.

lfglist.info: The command is used to get the list of the groups you've created. The bot will send you the list of your groups with the following information: name, time of start, channel name, server name, **ID**.

lfg.info: You can set up LFG either with arguments or in direct messages. For the latter, just don't pass any arguments for the command and answer the questions about the group.
lfg.creation:
__**Creating a group**__
List of 'lfg' command arguments. The arguments must be on the separate lines.
lfg.creation_note:
Every parameter should be in **separate lines**
`%Hh %Mm` - time format, in which one and a half hour activity will be written as `1h 30m` or `1.5h` or `90m`.
`%d-%m-%Y %H:%M%z` - time format, in which midnight at Moscow, Russia on February the 1st 2000 is written like `01-02-2000 00:00+0300`.
lfg.name: LFG name or planned activity
lfg.time: Time of the activity start, format %d-%m-%Y %H:%M%z
lfg.role: Names of the roles to mention, separated by ';'. Defaults to 'Guardian, Recruit, Destiny'
lfg.length: The duration of the activity, format '%Hh %Mm'
lfg.example_title: __Here's an example of LFG creation command:__
lfg.example_lfg:
lfg
-at: pve
-s: 3
-n: Nightfall
-t: 13-02-2020 19:00+0300
-d: Farm ascendant shards
-m: basic
-r: Guardian
-l: 01h 30m
lfg.edit_title:
__**LFG editing**__
Every group has it's own ID. To get information about your LFGs message the bot in DM `lfglist`. The bot will send you the list of your groups with the following information: name, time of start, channel name, server name, **ID**.
In order to edit the group send `editlfg` command in the channel you want the updated group announcement be in. The syntax is the same as in `lfg`
lfg.manual:
__**Managing manual groups**__
When someone presses 👌, the group owner will receive a message with a list of those, who wishes to participate along with some information about the group (time, channel, server).
To choose a person press the corresponding emote. The list will update. **Don't** press multiple emotes, wait for the list update!!!
lfg.use_lfg:
__**Participating in the group**__
Use 👌 to add yourself to the list of wishing to participate. The bot should confirm your emote. To remove yourself from the group delete your 👌 reaction.
Use ❓ to add yourself to the list of those, who are ready to help. To remove yourself from the list of on demand helpers delete your ❓ reaction.
Use ❌ to delete the group (works only for the group owner).
lfg.slash_info:
__**Creating a group**__
The bot will send you a form you'll need to fill. After that the bot will ask a couple of questions, that you can answer by clicking a button or by selecting options in a dropdown menu. After that the bot will process the data and ask you to confirm the information.
__**Participating and managing LFG**__
Click `I want to go` to add yourself to the list of wishing to participate. The bot should confirm that by responding to the button or by adding you to the list.
Click `I'll help/Maybe I'll go` to add yourself to the list of those, who are ready to help.
To remove yourself from the group click `Remove registration`
To delete the group click `Delete the post`

setprefix.info: Set prefixes for this server. To set multiple prefixes send them separated from each other with spaces, i.e. `setprefix ? !` to set `?` and `!` as prefixes. Send `none` as the parameter to disable all prefixes, except bot mention.

online.info: Get the list of online clan members.
online.name: online

editlfg.info:
__**Editing a group**__
You can either call this command from a group message context menu, or by running `/editlfg`. In the second case the bot will ask you to choose the group you want to edit. After that the bot will send you a form filled with that group info you'll need to edit. After that the bot will ask a couple of questions, that you can answer by clicking a button or by selecting options in a dropdown menu. After that the bot will process the data and ask you to confirm the information.
__**Participating and managing LFG**__
Click `I want to go` to add yourself to the list of wishing to participate. The bot should confirm that by responding to the button or by adding you to the list.
Click `I'll help/Maybe I'll go` to add yourself to the list of those, who are ready to help.
To remove yourself from the group click `Remove registration`
To delete the group click `Delete the post`

help.support: Get the link to the support server
help.online: Get the list of online clan members.
help.reglfg: Register the channel as a place for LFG posts

subcommands.remove: Make the bot stop posting updates in this channel

start.rotations: Make the bot start posting rotation updates in this channel
start.changelogs: Make the bot start posting changelogs in this channel

top.no_clan: There is no clan to get information from. Please use the `setclan` command to set up a valid Destiny 2 clan.
top.unknown_metric: Unknown metric `{}`. Use `help top` to get the list of available metrics.
top.in_progress: Getting the leaderboard, could take a long time.

mods.description: Currently available mods that Ada and Banshee sell
